dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 3664 IH: Allowing Commerce to Continue in the Event of Successive Shutdowns Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Brady of Pennsylvania introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To prohibit the Federal Government from preventing a private business from operating during a Government shutdown on Federal property leased by the business from the Federal Government.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Allowing Commerce to Continue in the Event of Successive Shutdowns Act or the ACCESS Act .

section.header: Prohibition on preventing private businesses from operating on leased Federal property during Government shutdown

subsection.text: No Federal department or agency may prevent a private business from operating its business during a Government shutdown if the business is located on property leased by the business from the Federal Government.

In this Act, the term Government shutdown means a period of a lapse in appropriations for any Federal department or agency as a result of a failure to enact a regular appropriations bill or continuing resolution.
